senses.de: To like one thing or person better than another.

Tips.title: Expressing Preferences
Tips.description: Use 'prefer' to express likes in a polite and indirect way, showing you have a choice.
Tips.example: I prefer classical music when I work.

Tips.title: Comparative Preference
Tips.description: 'Prefer' often involves a comparison between two things, indicating a favorite.

Tips.title: Gentle Suggestions
Tips.description: 'Prefer' can suggest choices in a gentle way, without demanding.
Tips.example: Would you prefer tea or coffee?

senses.de: To choose or want something rather than something else because you like it better.
senses.ex: He prefers going to the cinema to watching television.

Tips.title: Conscious Choice
Tips.description: 'Prefer' implies a deliberate choice or a well-considered liking for something.
Tips.example: Given the options, I prefer the blue one.

Tips.title: Future Decisions
Tips.description: Use 'would prefer' to talk about what you want to do in the future.
Tips.example: I would prefer to leave early tomorrow.

Tips.title: Describing Habits
Tips.description: 'Prefer' can describe habitual actions or tendencies.

senses.de: To suggest or state that one thing should be chosen or that you approve of it more than another.
senses.ex: The judge preferred the evidence of the first witness.

Tips.title: Legal Recommendations
Tips.description: In law, 'prefer' is used when officially recommending or selecting options.
Tips.example: The prosecutor will prefer charges of fraud.

Tips.title: Formal Endorsement
Tips.description: 'Prefer' often signals formal or official endorsement in a professional setting.
Tips.example: The committee prefers this policy change.

Choose.wordDefinition:
The words choose and prefer both refer to making a decision between two or more options, but they have slightly different meanings.

Choose is a more general term that simply means to pick one option over another. For example, if you are asked to choose between two desserts, you can simply pick the one you like better without any specific reason or preference.

You can use either word depending on how strong your liking is for one option over another. If you have a strong preference or a specific reason for choosing one thing over another, you can use "prefer." If you simply need to make a decision without any strong liking or reason, you can use "choose.".

Crave.wordDefinition:
Crave means to have a strong desire or urge for something, usually food, drink or a specific activity. It implies that you really want something and it is hard to resist.

For example, "I am craving pizza right now."

Both words are applicable in different situations. Use crave when you have a strong desire for something and prefer when you have a choice and like one option better than the other.

Desire.wordDefinition:
Desire means wanting something strongly, while prefer means liking one thing more than another.

For example, if you desire a new pair of shoes, it means you really want them. If you prefer a particular brand of shoes, it means you like that brand more than others.

Desire is applicable when you have a strong emotional connection to something, while preference is applicable when you have a more practical or rational reason for choosing one thing over another.

Desire is about strong emotions, while preference is about practical or rational reasons.

Elect.wordDefinition:
Elect means to choose someone or something based on a formal process, such as an election or a vote.

It is typically used in the context of selecting a leader, representative, or official.

For example, you might elect a student council president by tallying votes and following a formal election process. You might prefer a certain type of music or food based on your personal tastes and preferences.

Favour.wordDefinition:
Favour means to show kindness or support towards something or someone.

For example: "I would like to ask a favour of you. Could you please help me move this heavy box?"

Favour is more about doing something kind for someone else, while prefer is more about expressing your personal preference.

Pick.wordDefinition:
Pick means to choose one option or thing from a group of options or things. For example, if there are three books on a table and you choose one, you have 'picked' one book.

Pick is used when making a choice from a group of options, while prefer is used when expressing a personal liking or choice between two or more options.

Select.wordDefinition:
Select, on the other hand, means to choose something specific from a larger group or selection. For example, you might select a blue dress from a collection of dresses.

So basically, prefer is about personal preference while select is about making a specific choice from a larger range of options.

videos.Text: Imagine if you were Betsy. Would you prefer to know the truth? If the answer is yes, you'd be choosing an option that sharply decreases your net pleasure. Perhaps, then, you believe that there are things in life with greater intrinsic value than pleasure. Truth, knowledge, authentic connection with other human beings.

videos.Text: Repetition is a feature that music from cultures around the world tends to share. So, why does music rely so heavily on repetition? One part of the answer come from what psychologists call the mere-exposure effect. In short, people tend to prefer things they've been exposed to before.

quotes.Text: I prefer to win titles with the team ahead of individual awards or scoring more goals than anyone else. I'm more worried about being a good person than being the best football player in the world. When all this is over, what are you left with? When I retire, I hope I am remembered for being a decent guy.
quotes.Title: Argentinian Footballer
quotes.Name: Lionel Messi

quotes.Text: Some people have a difficult time facing truth and reality. They prefer to live in a make-believe world, pretending that certain things aren't happening.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: To know what you prefer instead of humbly saying Amen to what the world tells you ought to prefer, is to have kept your soul alive.
quotes.Title: Scottish Writer
quotes.Name: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.Text: I prefer to be a dreamer among the humblest, with visions to be realized, than lord among those without dreams and desires.
quotes.Title: Lebanese Poet
quotes.Name: Khalil Gibran

quotes.Text: I prefer peace. But if trouble must come, let it come in my time, so that my children can live in peace.
quotes.Title: English Activist
quotes.Name: Thomas Paine

quotes.Text: I would prefer to just continue to speak about truth and to speak about what makes sense.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: It's a social life, or time to read the comment section: I prefer social life.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Katya Zamolodchikova

quotes.Text: I have always preferred the reflection of the life to life itself.
quotes.Title: French Director
quotes.Name: Francois Truffaut

quotes.Text: People should always have something which they prefer to life.
quotes.Title: German Theologian
quotes.Name: Johann G. Seume

quotes.Text: I support Medicare for all. It is my preferred policy.
quotes.Title: American Vice President
quotes.Name: Kamala Harris
